main event: A bright light was observed to the west of Baker Lake, Canada on April 25, 1962.
interesting points: The light was seen for about 10 seconds with no sound or color,The observation was stationary,The weather was described as dry and clear during the sighting,There is no record of artificial satellites or man-made devices involved in this sighting,An electronic tape recording verified the object's presence and demonstrated rapid acceleration and deceleration.
witness description: Observers faced Northwest and saw the bright light.
